profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Ken Kobus is a retired engineer for the LTV Steel Corporation who worked in the steel industry for over 40 years. His collection includes photographic slides documenting the railroad and steel industry from Pennsylvania to Illinois taken during the 1980s and 2008s. Pittsburgh and world environments are documented through photographic slides. The collection also includes presentations used at lectures for historical groups, such as the Pennsylvania Railroad Historical Society, as well as supplementary material in the forms of photographic prints, negatives, VHS videos, and compact discs. Digital reproductions of the collection are available online.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Born March 19, 1948, Ken Kobus grew up in the working-class Pittsburgh neighborhood of the South Side, just eight blocks from the steel mill where his father and grandfather worked for the Jones & Laughlin Steel Company. Ken followed in their footsteps, also having a career in the steel industry for over 40 years. He is an avid photographer, amateur astronomer, and enthusiast of railroad and steel industry history. A published author, he has four books and numerous articles to his credit.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of the collection are available electronically at http://historicpittsburgh.org/collection/ken-kobus-collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Ken Kobus Collection focuses on the changing nature of the railroad and steel industries during the post-industrial era of the 1980s and the early 1990s. The collection documents a geographical corridor from Pittsburgh to Chicago, with ConRail and the LTV Steel Company as the primary focus. Secondary points of interest include the Pennsylvania Railroad, Union Pacific Railroad, Amtrak, and Union Switch and Signal companies. Presentations given by Ken Kobus on these industries and the changes they underwent remain complete and unchanged within the collection. The collection also includes material concerning city environments, boats, and rivers. The University of Pittsburgh environment is featured as a sampling of campus shots and football games while riverboats around the Point area and views of Downtown document the Pittsburgh environment. The collection is mainly comprised of photographic slide material, with a small accompaniment of photographic prints, photographic negatives, and other multimedia, including VHS tapes and digital photos on compact discs. A portion of the Kobus photographs were digitized and are accessible online at: http://historicpittsburgh.org/collection/ken-kobus-collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The arrangement of the Ken Kobus Collection has been kept substantially in its original form. The processor derived the intellectual organization from the unprocessed physical organization of the collection.
Series VII. Photographic Prints and Negatives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ken Kobus in December 2006.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: Ken Kobus maintained these records until he donated them to the ASC in 2006.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Ken Kobus Collection, 1980-2008, AIS.2006.18, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ken Kobus Collection, 1980-2008, AIS.2006.18, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Robert Presutti, January 2007. The collection was physically reorganized and the finding aid revised by John Tomasicchio in June 2009.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Railroad Industry Series includes a broad volume of photographic slides covering the daily workings of several major railway companies, including Amtrak, Pennsylvania Railroad, ConRail, Union Pacific, and Union Switch and Signal. These slides focus on companies, towns, railroad equipment, and rail yards. Several generic railroad sections, created independently and originally named Miscellaneous, are present. These sections contain a mix of topics pertaining to the railway industry, including trains, town environs, wrecks, and yards. The series dates from 1985 to 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The River Boat Series contains photographic slides of river boats in Pittsburgh, mostly around the Point. The river boat section includes barges along the Ohio, Monongahela, and Allegheny rivers as well as a small selection of stern-wheel boats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Steel Industry Series includes photographic slides depicting industrial main areas during the last weeks of production at LTV Steel Company in Pittsburgh, the Carrie Furnaces, the Erie Mining Company (Minnesota), and the Pennsylvania Canal on Pittsburgh's North Side. The steel mill images are interior shots of active industrial complexes with limited shots of facility employees.

did.unittitle: LTV Pittsburgh Steel Plant (Last week of operations); PAT Train; Carrie Furnace; Eliza Furnace

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Pittsburgh Environs Series includes photographic slides depicting University of Pittsburgh buildings, football games, and campus scenes. Also included in this series are slides that document the downtown Pittsburgh environment and the historic Pennsylvania Canal.

did.unittitle: University of Pittsburgh versus Maryland, Phipps Conservatory, University of Pittsburgh Campus Views
University of Pittsburgh versus Penn State
Pennsylvania Canal (1987), Downtown Pittsburgh, Miscellaneous Pittsburgh Environs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Travel Series contains slides relating to Ken Kobus' various world travels. These slides depict buildings, historic landmarks, ruins, and natural surroundings that distinguish these assorted locations. Travel locations include London, Chicago, Philadelphia, the Kennedy Space Center, Ricketts Glen State Park, Mount Everest, Mexico, and Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Presentations Series dates between 1985 and 1992 and includes complete photographic slide presentations assembled by Ken Kobus covering the steel industry and the railroad industry from different locations in the Pittsburgh to Chicago railroad transportation corridor and in San Francisco. The presentations were created for lectures provided to historical societies and industrial enthusiasts.

did.unittitle: Presentation 4 and 5: Railroad Industry; Brashear Telescope; History of Coke-making
Presentation 7: Railroad Industry and Railways Transportation
Presentation 10: Railroad Industry; Chicago Railway Fair
Presentation 12: Pittsburgh and Lake Erie Railroad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Photographic Prints and Negatives Series contains images and negatives relating to the railroad and steel industry as well as Ken Kobus' lecture series. Prints include images of the Pennsylvania Canal from 1987, when Lock No. 4 was dug up on the North Side during construction of I-279 North. Also included are photographic prints of Ken Kobus' lecture at the Heinz History Center and the dedication of the Clinton Furnace at Bessemer Court at Station Square as well as oversize photographic prints of the Pittsburgh LTV Steel plant and a Jones & Laughlin Steel Company locomotive. This series contains three photographic CDs, which contain digital photos pertaining to the Main Midwest Central Railroad, the Erie Mining Company images and Schnabel images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: CD 01: Erie Mining Photos for Line Side: Dated September 28, 2005; contains 28 images in the JPEG format
CD 02: Schnabel Photos for Line Side: Dated September 28, 2005; contains 19 images in the JPEG format
CD 03: MCRR Photo Line Side: Dated September 28, 2005; contains 78 images in the JPEG format

did.unittitle: Stereoview, Union Depot and Environs before Railroad Strike

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two stereoviews dating between 1890 and 1895 depicting activities at the Works. One view shows holes being drilled into a rail to bolt to splice rails. The second view depicts workers making a Bessemer bottom for a Bessemer convertor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Videocassette Series is comprised of five promotional and instructional VHS tapes relating to the railroad and riverboat series. Included in this series are a Juniata/Hollidaysburg Remanufacturing Facilities promotional video, a ConRail general instructional video, a ConRail Electro-motive Diesel instructional video, a Gateway Clipper Fleet promotional video about charter services, and a LTV Steel promotional video.
